Pre-Game Insights: Bahrain aims to showcase improved performance in the Asian Cup 2024, answering questions about their inconsistency.
The match against Australia will be a crucial test for Bahrain, as they prepare to face Korea, Yordania, and Malaysia in the elimination round.
Australia, with a younger squad for the Asian Cup 2024, has a more promising record, having won two recent international matches against Bangladesh and Palestine.

Bahrain relies on a local league-based squad, with players like Moses Atede (Kedah Darul Aman, Malaysia), Ali Madan (Ajman, UAE), and Abdulla Yusuf Helal (Mada Boleslav, Czech Republic) being the exceptions.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will take place at the Stadion Baniyas in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates, and can be watched live on FlashScore and Soccerway.
Others: Bahrain finished 8th in the FIFA rankings, while Australia is ranked 25th.

Australia has called up several new players for the Asian Cup 2024, including Gethin Jones (Bolton Wanderers), Patrick Yazbek (Viking), and John Iredale (Wehen Wiesbaden) who have yet to represent the national team.Samuel Silvera (Middlesbrough), a 23-year-old forward with 2 caps for Australia, is expected to be one of Graham Arnold's key players in the front line.
